newsitem.title: USA: U.S. refined lead output falls in Jan to Aug.
newsitem.headline: U.S. refined lead output falls in Jan to Aug.

text.p: U.S. refined lead production fell to 246,922 short tons in January to August from 272,501 short tons in the same period last year, American Bureau of Metal Statistics reported.
The dip partly reflected ASARCO's pullout from refining at its Omaha site mid-year. Bullion produced by the company is now sold to refiners in Canada, Mexico and the U.S.
In August 27,234 short tons of lead was refined in the U.S., down from 28,153 short tons in July and 32,251 short tons in August 1995.

Shipments from plants only totaled 246,688 short tons in January to August compared to 267,488 short tons in the same period last year. Shipments in August were 33,517 short tons, up from 27,695 short tons in July and down from 40,269 short tons in August 1995.
Refined lead inventory at lead refiners own plants were 15,514 short tons in August, down from 21,797 short tons in July, and 14,943 short tons in August 1995.
Inventory elsewhere in the U.S. totaled 151 short tons in August.
